RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_PREEMPTION_THRESHOLD
RefParameter.Description: This option sets the sets the level of priority at which the Client thread allows preemption. The default NetX Duo SNTP Client value is set to NX_SNTP_CLIENT_ THREAD_PRIORITY.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_SLOW_PERIODIC_TIME_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: This is timeout period in timer ticks for the DHCP Server slow timer to check on IP address lease time remaining and handle lease that have timed out.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_HOSTNAME_MAX
RefParameter.Description: This is size of the buffer for holding the Client host name in the current DHCP Server Client session. The default value is 32.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV6_ERROR_MESSAGE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables NetX Duo from sending an ICMPv6 error message in response to a problem packet (e.g., improperly formatted header or packet header type is deprecated) received from another host.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_MAX_LEASES
RefParameter.Description: Defines the size of the Serverâ€™s IP lease table (e.g. the max number of IPv6 address available to lease that can be stored). By default, this value is 100.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_WINDOW_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Server socket window size. By default, this value is 2048 bytes

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_UDP_TX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables the UDP checksum computation on outgoing UDP packets. This is useful if the network interface driver is able to compute UDP header checksum and insert the value in the IP head before transmitting the data, and the application does not enable IPsec or IP fragmentation logic.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MAX_TIME_ADJUSTMENT
RefParameter.Description: The maximum time adjustment in milliseconds the Client will make to its local clock time. For time adjustments above this amount, the local clock adjustment is limited to the maximum time adjustment. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is 180000 (3 minutes).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_MIN_RENEW_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies minimum wait option for receiving a DHCP Server message and sending a renewal request after the DHCP Client is bound to an IP address. The default value is 60 seconds. However, the DHCP Client uses the Renew and Rebind expiration times from the DHCP server message before defaulting to the minimum renew timeout.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_USER_CREATE_PACKET_POOL
RefParameter.Description: If set, the DHCP Client will not create its own packet pool. The host application must use the nx_dhcp_packet_pool_set service to set the DHCP Client packet pool. The default value is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SESSION_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Define the session time out in seconds. This is the timer for how long the server has not received a client response. The default value is set to 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_FRAGMENT_OPTION
RefParameter.Description: This defines the Server socket fragmentation option. The default value is NX_DONT_FRAGMENT.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_SEND_MAX_DHCP_MESSAGE_OPTION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this enables the DHCP Client to send maximum DHCP message size option. By default, this option is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_MAX_HEADER_FIELD
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum size of the HTTP header field. The default value is 256.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_ACK_TIMER_RATE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies how the number of system ticks (NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE) is divided to calculate the timer rate for the TCP delayed ACK processing. The default value is 5, which represents 200ms, and is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_TCP_RX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables checksum logic on received TCP packets. This is only useful in situations in which the link-layer has reliable checksum or CRC processing, or the interface driver is able to verify the TCP checksum in hardware, and the application does not use IPsec.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ICMPV6_MAX_RTR_SOLICITATIONS
RefParameter.Description: Define the max number of router solicitations a host sends until a router response is received. If no response is received, the host concludes no router is present. The default value is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option sets the size of the Client thread stack. The default NetX Duo SNTP Client size is 2048.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_IP_GATEWAY_AND_DNS_SERVER
RefParameter.Description: If defined and the Client IPv4 gateway address is non zero, the DNS Client sets the IPv4 gateway as the Clientâ€™s primary DNS server. The default value is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Size of the DHCP thread stack. By default, the size is 4096 bytes.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_HMAC_MAX_PAD_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the hmac max pad size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_DISABLE_X509
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option disables X509 feature.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_X509_CRL_VERIFY_EXTENSION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables X509 crl verify extension.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_SERVER_UDP_PORT
RefParameter.Description: This is port which the Client sends SNTP messages to the SNTP Server on. The default NetX SNTP Server port is 123.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_KEEPALIVE_RETRY
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of seconds between retries of the keepalive timer assuming the other side of the connection is not responding. The default value is 75, which represents 75 seconds between retries, and is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_PACKET_DEBUG_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, logs packet debug information.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_PASSWORD_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of â€œpasswordâ€ strings used in authentication. The default value is set to 32bytes, but can be redefined prior to inclusion of nx_ppp.h.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_PACKET_PAYLOAD
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size in bytes of the DHCP Client packet payload. The default value is NX_DHCP_MINIMUM_IP_DATAGRAM + physical header size. The physical header size in a wireline network is usually the Ethernet frame size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_FAST_PERIODIC_TIME_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: This is timeout period in timer ticks for the DHCP Server fast timer to check on session time remaining and handle sessions that have timed out.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_THREAD_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: Priority of the Client thread. By default, this value specifies that the Client thread runs at priority 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IGMPV2
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables IGMPv2 support, and NetX Duo supports IGMPv1 only. By default this option is not set and is defined in nx_api.h.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_RETRY_SHIFT
RefParameter.Description: This value is used to set the next retransmission timeout. The current timeout is multiplied by the number of retransmissions thus far, shifted by the value of the socket timeout shift.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_PACKET_PAYLOAD_UNALIGNED
RefParameter.Description: If not defined, the size of the Client packet payload which includes the Ethernet, IP (or IPv6), and UDP headers plus the maximum DNS message size specified by NX_DNS_MESSAGE_MAX. Regardless if defined, the packet payload is the 4-byte aligned and stored in NX_DNS_PACKET_PAYLOAD. The default value is (NX_UDP_PACKET + NX_DNS_MESSAGE_MAX).

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_MAX_NAME
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of bytes allowed in a client supplied username. The default value is set to 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_MAXIMUM_SEGMENT_LIFETIME
RefParameter.Description: Number of seconds for maximum segment lifetime, the default is 2 minutes (120s)

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_ENABLE_SECURE_RENEGOTIATION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables secure renegotiation.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_ACK_EVERY_N_PACKETS
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of TCP packets to receive before sending an ACK. Note if NX_TCP_IMMEDIATE_ACK is enabled but NX_TCP_ACK_EVERY_N_PACKETS is not, this value is automatically set to 1 for backward compatibility.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_RECORD_TABLE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This is size of the DHCP Server array for holding Client records. The default value is 50.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_PROBE_NUM
RefParameter.Description: The number of ARP probes to send. By default, this value is defined as 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_TCP_TX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables checksum logic for sending TCP packets. This is only useful in situations in which the receiving network node has received TCP checksum logic disabled or the underlying network driver is capable of generating the TCP checksum, and the application does not use IPsec.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_IP_ADDRESS_MAX_LIST_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This is size of the DHCP Server array for holding available IP addresses for assigning to the Client. The default value is 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SERVER_DUID_VENDOR_PRIVATE_ID
RefParameter.Description: Sets the enterprise type of the DUID to private vendor type.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_OPTIONS_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Size of DHCP options buffer. By default, this value is 312 bytes.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ARP_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables ARP information gathering.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_FAST_TIMER_RATE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies how the number of NetX Duo internal ticks (NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE) is divided to calculate the fast TCP timer rate. The fast TCP timer is used to drive the various TCP timers, including the delayed ACK timer. The default value is 10, which represents 100ms assuming the ThreadX timer is running at 10ms. This value is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_PREMASTER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the sie of pre-master secret. The pre-master secret should be at least 66 bytes for ECDH/ECDHE with secp521r1 (The default value is 68). The pre-master secret is 48 bytes, except for PSK ciphersuites for which it may be more.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DEBUG_LOG_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Size of debug log (number of entries in the debug log). On reaching the last entry, the debug capture wraps to the first entry and overwrites any data previously captured. The default value is 50.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_AEAD_CIPHER_CHECK
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables AEAD ciphersuites other than AES-CCM or AES-GCM working.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_TCP_MSS_CHECK
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the verification of minimum peer MSS before accepting a TCP connection. To use this feature, the symbol NX_ENABLE_TCP_MSS_MINIMUM must be defined. By default, this option is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_HUGE_NUMBER_BITS
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the huge number bits.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_MAX_IA_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: The maximum number of IA addresses that can be added to the Client record. The default value is 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RESPONSE_TC_DELAY_RANGE
RefParameter.Description: The delay range, in ticks, in responding to a query with TC bit. The default value is 10 ticks for 100ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_X509_CERTIFICATE_INITIALIZE_EXTENSION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables X509 certificate initialize extension.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DISABLE_PAP
RefParameter.Description: If defined, internal PPP PAP logic is removed.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_CLIENT_DISABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Defined, this option removes all TLS/DTLS stack code related to Client mode, reducing code and data usage.
NX_SECURE_TLS_CLIENT_DISABLED and NX_SECURE_TLS_SERVER_DISABLED are mutually exclusive: either NX_SECURE_TLS_CLIENT_DISABLED or NX_SECURE_TLS_SERVER_DISABLED must be disabled

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Can be true only if NX_SECURE_TLS_SERVER_DISABLED is false

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_X509_CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_EXTENSION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables certificate verify extension.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SERVER_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This defines the size of the DHCPv6 thread stack. By default, the size is 4096 bytes which is more than enough for most NetX Duo applications.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_TRANSMIT_TIMER_RATE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies how the number of system ticks (NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE) is divided to calculate the timer rate for the TCP transmit retry processing. The default value is 1, which represents 1 second, and is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_TCP_WINDOW_SCALING
RefParameter.Description: Enables the window scaling option for TCP applications. If defined, window scaling option is negotiated during TCP connection phase, and the application is able to specify a window size larger than 64K. The default setting is not enabled (not defined).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_DISABLE_ERROR_CHECKING
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option removes the basic NetX Secure error checking. It is typically used after the application has been debugged.

RefParameter.DefaultValue: IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-CLIENT NOT ON LINK
RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_NOT_ON_LINK
RefParameter.Description: This defines the status option message for : NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_NOT_ON_LINK. The default value is "IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-CLIENT NOT ON LINK".

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_ANNOUNCE_NUM
RefParameter.Description: The number of ARP announces to send. By default, this value is defined as 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_MAX_LCP_PROTOCOL_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: This defines the max number of retries if the PPP times out before sending another LCP configure request message. When this number is reached the PPP handshake is aborted and the link status is down. The default value is 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_QUERY_DELAY_RANGE
RefParameter.Description: The delay range for sending first query, in ticks. The default value is 10 ticks for 100ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_PACKET_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Time out for NetX Duo packet allocation. The default NetX Duo SNTP Client packet timeout is 1 second.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_PACKET_CHAIN
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables the packet chain logic. By default this is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_PING_TIMEOUT_DELAY
RefParameter.Description: Defines the MQTT timer rate, in ThreadX timer ticks. This timer is used to keep track of the time since last MQTT control message was sent, and sends out an MQTT PINGREQ message before the keep-alive time expires. This timer is activated if the client connects to the broker with a keep-alive timer value set. The default value is TX_TIMER_TICKS_PER_SECOND, which is a one-second timer.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_QUERY_DELAY_MIN
RefParameter.Description: The minimum delay for sending first query, in ticks. The default value is 2 ticks for 20ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_DEFEND_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: The number of seconds to wait between defense announces. By default, this value is defined as 10.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_IP_STATIC_ROUTING
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables IPv4 static routing in which a destination address can be assigned a specific next hop address. By default IPv4 static routing is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ICMPV6_RTR_SOLICITATION_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the interval between two router solicitation messages. The default value is 4.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_DOMAIN_NAME_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Size of the buffer in the Client record to hold the clientâ€™s network domain name. The default value is 32.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IP_MAX_REASSEMBLY_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that controls maximum time allowed to reassemble IPv4 fragment and IPv6 fragment. Note the value defined here overwrites both NX_IPV4_MAX_REASSEMBLY_TIME and NX_IPV6_MAX_REASSEMBLY_TIME.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_PPPOE_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, PPP can transmit packet over Ethernet.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_MIN_PACKET_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the minimum size of the packets in the pool specified at Server creation. The minimum size is needed to ensure the complete HTTP header can be contained in one packet. The default value is set to 600.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ARP_DEFEND_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: Defines the interval, in seconds, the ARP module sends out the next defend packet in response to an incoming ARP message that indicates an address in conflict.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_MIN_PACKET_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the minimum size of the packets in the pool specified at server creation. The minimum size is needed to ensure the complete HTTP header can be contained in one packet. The default value is set to 600.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_SECURE_MEMCMP
RefParameter.Description: Define memcmp function used internal.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV6_REDIRECT_PROCESS
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables ICMPv6 redirect packet processing. NetX Duo by default processes redirect messages and updates the destination table with next hop IP address information.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_SERIAL_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of the receive character serial buffer. By default, this value is 3,000 bytes. This define can be set by the application prior to inclusion of nx_ppp.h. By default, it is NX_PPP_MRU*2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_TIME_TO_LIVE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of routers a Client packet can pass before it is discarded. The default NetX Duo SNTP Client is set to 0x80(NX_IP_TIME_TO_LIVE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_KEEPALIVE_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: Specifies how many keepalive retries are allowed before the connection is deemed broken. The default value is 10, which represents 10 retries, and is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_UDP_RX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables the UDP checksum computation on incoming UDP packets. This is useful if the network interface driver is able to verify UDP header checksum in hardware, and the application does not enable IPsec or IP fragmentation logic.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_MAX_RESOURCE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of bytes allowed in a client supplied resource name. The default value is set to 40.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DEBUG
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the optional print debug information available from the RAM Ethernet network driver.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_ARP_PROBE_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Defines the maximum variation in the interval between sending ARP probes. The value is defaulted to 2 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_IP_RAW_PACKET_FILTER
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the IP raw packet receive filter functionality. Applications requiring more control over the type of raw IP packets to be received can use this feature. The IP raw packet filter feature also supports the raw socket operation in the BSD compatibility layer. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_RETRY_MAX
RefParameter.Description: This sets the maximum number of retransmissions on Server socket. The default value is set to 10.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_TYPE_OF_SERVICE
RefParameter.Description: Type of service required for the HTTP TCP requests. By default, this value is defined as NX_IP_NORMAL to indicate normal IP packet service.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_SUCCESS
RefParameter.Description: This defines the status option message for : NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_SUCCESS. The default value is "IA OPTION GRANTED".

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_RETRY_SECONDS
RefParameter.Description: Set the Server socket retransmission timeout in seconds. The default value is set to 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_MAX_RESOURCE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of bytes allowed in a client supplied resource name. The default value is set to 40.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_PACKET
RefParameter.Description: Define the packet header.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ARP_MAXIMUM_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of ARP retries made without an ARP response. The default value is 18 and is defined in nx_api.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_SLEEP_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: The time interval during which the SNTP Client task sleeps. This allows the application API calls to be executed by the SNTP Client. The default value is 1 timer tick.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_USE_DF
RefParameter.Description: This option define drbg use df.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_PACKET_POOL_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Size of the Client packet pool for sending DNS queries if NX_DNS_CLIENT_USER_CREATE_PACKET_POOL is not defined. The default value is large enough for 16 packets of payload size defined by NX_DNS_PACKET_PAYLOAD, and is 4-byte aligned. The default value is (16 * (NX_DNS_PACKET_PAYLOAD + sizeof(NX_PACKET))).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IP_RX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables checksum logic on received IPv4 packets. This is useful if the network device is able to verify the IPv4 checksum, and the application does not expect to use IP fragmentation or IPsec.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_FRAGMENT_OPTION
RefParameter.Description: Sets the socket property to allow or disallow fragmentation of outgoing packets. The default value is NX_DONT_FRAGMENT.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_ENABLE_TLS_1_1
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables the legacy TLSv1.1 mode. TLSv1.1 is considered obsolete so it should only be enabled for backward-compatibility with older applications.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_FRAGMENT_OPTION
RefParameter.Description: Fragment enable for HTTP TCP requests. By default, this value is NX_DONT_FRAGMENT to disable HTTP TCP fragmenting.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_MRU
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the Maximum Receive Unit (MRU) for PPP. By default, this value is 1,500 bytes (the minimum value). This define can be set by the application prior to inclusion of nx_ppp.h.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV4_MAX_REASSEMBLY_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that controls maximum time allowed to reassemble IPv4 fragment. Note the value defined in NX_IP_MAX_REASSEMBLY_TIME overwrites this value. The default value is 15.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_ENABLE_TLS_1_3
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables TLSv1.3 mode. TLS 1.3 is the newest version of TLS and is disabled by default.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_POOF_TIMER_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: Define the Passive Observation Of Failures timer count, 10 seconds in spec (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Defines the maximum size of the Server message in status option message field . The default value is 100 bytes.

RefParameter.Name: NX_RETRANS_TIMER
RefParameter.Description: Specifies in milliseconds the length of delay between solicitation packets sent by NetX Duo. Defined in nx_nd_cache.h, the default value is 1000.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_TYPE_OF_SERVICE
RefParameter.Description: This defines the type of service for UDP packet transmission from the DHCPv6 Client socket. The default value is NX_IP_NORMAL.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_MAX_PENDING
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of connections that can be queued for the HTTPS Server. The default value is set to twice the maximum number of server sessions ((NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_SESSION_MAX << 1).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_UNICAST_POLL_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: The starting poll interval (seconds) on which the Client sends a unicast request to its SNTP server. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is 3600.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_MAX_CLIENTS
RefParameter.Description: Defines the size of the Serverâ€™s Client record table (e.g. max number of Clients that can be stored). This value should be less than or equal to the value NX_DHCPV6_MAX_LEASES.By default, this value is 120.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SERVER_THREAD_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: This defines the DHCPv6 Server thread priority. This should be lower than the DHCPv6 Serverâ€™s IP thread task priority. The default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RR_TTL_OTHER
RefParameter.Description: TTL value for other resource records, in second. The default value is 4500 for 75 minutes.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_FIPS
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables extra security features required for FIPS-Compliant usage. This option is not enabled for non-FIPS build.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_TRANSMIT_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: This specifies the maximum number of packets that can be enqueued on the Server socket retransmission queue. If the number of packets enqueued reaches this number, no more packets can be sent until one or more enqueued packets are released. The default value is set to 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_ANNOUNCING_TIMER_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The time interval, in ticks, between mDNS announcement messages. The default value is 25 ticks for 250ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_RESTORE_STATE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, this enables the DHCP Client to save its current DHCP Client license â€˜stateâ€™ including time remaining on the lease, and restore this state between DHCP Client application reboots. The default value is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MIN_TIME_ADJUSTMENT
RefParameter.Description: The minimum time adjustment in milliseconds the Client will make to its local clock time. Time adjustments below this will be ignored. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is 10.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_TRANSMIT_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: This specifies the maximum number of packets that can be enqueued on the Server socket retransmission queue. If the number of packets enqueued reaches this number, no more packets can be sent until one or more enqueued packets are released.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_WINDOW_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Server socket window size. By default, this value is 8192.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_GOODBYE_TIMER_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The time interval, in ticks, between repeated "goodbye" messages. The default value is 25 ticks for 250ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_KEEPALIVE_INITIAL
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of seconds of inactivity before the keepalive timer activates. The default value is 7200, which represents 2 hours, and is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_MAXIMUM_RX_QUEUE
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that defines the maximum receive queue for TCP sockets. This feature is enabled by NX_ENABLE_LOW_WATERMARK.

Condition.Diagnostic: Can be set to enabled only if NX_ENABLE_LOW_WATERMARK is set

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_MAX_SERVERS
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of DNS Servers in the Client server list. The default value is 5.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_MAXIMUM_TX_QUEUE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum depth of the TCP transmit queue before TCP send requests are suspended or rejected. The default value is 20, which means that a maximum of 20 packets can be in the transmit queue at any given time. Note packets stay in the transmit queue until an ACK that covers some or all of the packet data is received from the other side of the connection. This constant is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DNS_ADDRESS_MAX_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: This specifies how many times the PPP host will request a DNS Server address from the peer in the IPCP state. This has no effect if NX_PPP_DNS_OPTION_DISABLE is defined. The default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_DTLS_RETRANSMIT_RETRY_SHIFT
RefParameter.Description: This option defines how the retransmit timeout period changes between successive retries. If this value is 0, the initial retransmit timeout is the same as subsequent retransmit timeouts. If this value is 1, each successive retransmit is twice as long.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_DEFAULT_LEASE_TIME
RefParameter.Description: This is IP Address lease time in seconds assigned to the DHCP Client, and the basis for computing the renewal and rebind times also assigned to the Client. The default value is set to (10 * NX_DHCP_SLOW_PERIODIC_TIME_INTERVAL).

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DEBUG_FRAME_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Maximum amount of data captured from a received packet payload and saved to debug output. The default value is 50.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of maximum depth of receive queue. The default value is set to 4.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_X509_STRICT_NAME_COMPARE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables strict distinguished name comparison for X.509 certificates for certificate searching and verification. The default is to only compare the Common Name fields of the Distinguished Names.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_TIME_ZONE_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Size of the buffer in the Client record to hold the Clientâ€™s time zone. The default value is 16.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_CLIENT_THREAD_TIME_SLICE
RefParameter.Description: Define the default MQTT Thread time slice.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_UDP_SOCKET_NAME
RefParameter.Description: This option sets the UDP socket name. The NetX Duo SNTP Client UDP socket name default is â€œSNTP Client socket.â€.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: This defines the wait option (in timer ticks) for allocating packets to transmit data as well as buffer PPP serial data into packets to send to the IP layer. The default value is 4*NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE (400 ticks).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_RARP_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables RARP information gathering.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_X509_PARSE_CRL_EXTENSION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables X509 parse crl extension.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_DOMAIN_NAME_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Maximum string size for domain name. The default value is 16. Does not include the NULL terminator.

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_SLAVE_CLASS_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: This value is the maximum number of classes in the device stack that can be loaded by USBX

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SERVER_DUID_TYPE
RefParameter.Description: This defines the Server DUID type which the Server includes in all messages to Clients. The default value is link layer plus time (NX_DHCPV6_SERVER_DUID_TYPE_LINK_TIME).

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_DISCONNECT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_socket_disconnect() calls. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_IP_LIFETIME_TIMER_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: Time interval in seconds at which the IP lifetime timer updates the length of time the current IP address has been assigned to the Client. By default, this value is 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SESSION_TIMER_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: Time interval in seconds at which the session timer updates the length of time the Client has been in session communicating with the Server. By default, this value is 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ARP_UPDATE_RATE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of seconds between ARP retries. The default value is 10, which represents 10 seconds, and is defined in nx_api.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_HOST_NAME_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Maximum string size for host name. The default value is 64. Does not include the NULL terminator.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_POWER_ON_SELF_TEST_MODULE_INTEGRITY_CHECK
RefParameter.Description: This option enables module integrity self test.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_MAX_OPTION_REQUEST_OPTIONS
RefParameter.Description: This defines the maximum number of option requests in a Client request that can be saved to a Client record. The default value is 6.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_ENABLE_HOST_NAME_CHECK
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this enables the DHCP Client to check the input host name in the nx_dhcp_create call for invalid characters or length. By default, this option is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_PACKET_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This defines the packet payload of the Server packet pool packets. The default value is 500 bytes.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DISABLE_INFO
RefParameter.Description: If defined, internal PPP information gathering is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_GOODBYE_RETRANSMIT_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The number of retransmitted "goodbye" messages. The default value is 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MAX_PHYSICAL_INTERFACES
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the total number of physical network interfaces on the device. The default value is 1 and is defined in nx_api.h; a device must have at least one physical interface. Note this does not include the loopback interface.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV6_TX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables and ICMPv6 checksum computation on transmitted ICMP packets.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV4_ERROR_MESSAGE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, NetX Duo does not send ICMPv4 Error Messages in response to error conditions such as improperly formatted IPv4 header. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ARP_AUTO_ENTRY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables entering ARP request information in the ARP cache.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RESPONSE_SHARED_DELAY_RANGE
RefParameter.Description: The delay range, in ticks, in responding to a query to a shared resource. The default value is 10 ticks for 100ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_MAX_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: The maximum number of times the DNS Client will query the current DNS server before trying another server or aborting the DNS query. The default value is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_MAX_RSA_MODULUS_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option gives the maximum RSA modulus expected, in bits. The default value is 4096 for a 4096-bit modulus. Other values can be 3072, 2048, or 1024 (not recommended).

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_MAX_CHAP_PROTOCOL_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: This defines the max number of retries if the PPP times out before sending another CHAP challenge message. When this number is reached the PPP handshake is aborted and the link status is down. The default value is 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_X509_DISABLE_CRL
RefParameter.Description: This option disables X509 Certificate Revocation List check.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV6_ROUTER_SOLICITATION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables NetX Duo from sending IPv6 router solicitation messages at regular intervals to the router.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_HASHED_VALUE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of â€œhashed valueâ€ strings used in CHAP authentication. The default value is set to 16 bytes, but can be redefined prior to inclusion of nx_ppp.h.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_MAX_SEED_LIFE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the drbg max seed life. The default value is 100000.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_DEFAULT_PREFERRED_TIME
RefParameter.Description: This defines the time in seconds assigned bythe Server for when an assigned Client IP address lease is deprecated. The default value is 2 NX_DHCPV6_DEFAULT_T1_TIME.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_CLOUD_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enable MQTT over cloud option.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_FRAGMENT_OPTION
RefParameter.Description: Fragment enable for DHCP UDP requests. By default, this value is NX_DONT_FRAGMENT to disable DHCP UDP fragmenting.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_INTERFACE_CAPABILITY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows the interface device driver to specify extra capability information, such as checksum off-loading. By default this option is not defined.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Active only if NX_ENABLE_TCPIP_OFFLOAD is disabled

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IPV4
RefParameter.Description:
Defined, disables IPv4 functionality. This option can be used to build NetX Duo to suupport IPv6 only. By default this option is not defined.
NX_DISABLE_IPV4 and NX_DISABLE_IPV6 are mutually exclusive: either IPv4 or IPv6 must be disabled

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Can be true only if NX_DISABLE_IPV6 is false

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IPV6
RefParameter.Description:
Disables IPv6 functionality when the NetX Duo library is built. For applications that do not need IPv6, this avoids pulling in code and additional storage space needed to support IPv6.
NX_DISABLE_IPV4 and NX_DISABLE_IPV6 are mutually exclusive: either IPv4 or IPv6 must be disabled

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Can be true only if NX_DISABLE_IPV4 is false

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_IPV6_PATH_MTU_DISCOVERY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the IPv6 path MTU discovery feature. By default this option is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_IP_LEASE_TIMER_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: Timer interval in seconds when the lease timer entry function is called by the ThreadX scheduler. The entry function sets a flag for the DHCPv6 Server to increment all Clientsâ€™ accrued time on their lease by the timer interval. By default, this value is 60.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_TIME_TO_LIVE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of routers this packet can pass before it is discarded. The default value is set to 0x80.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IP_TX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables checksum logic on IPv4 packets sent. This is useful in situations in which the underlying network device is capable of generating the IPv4 header checksum, and the application does not expect to use IP fragmentation or IPsec.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_HARDWARE_RAND_INITIALIZE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables crypto hardware random initialize.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_PREFERENCE_VALUE
RefParameter.Description: This defines the preference option value between 0 and 255, where the higher the value the higher the preference, in the DHCPv6 option of the same name. This tells the Client what preference to place on this Serverâ€™s offer where multiple DHCPv6 Servers are available to assign IP addresses. A value of 255 instructs the Client to choose this server. A value of zero indicates the Client is free to choose. The default value is zero.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_MINIMUM_MRU
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the minimum MRU received in an LCP configure request message. By default, this value is 1,500 bytes (the minimum value). This define can be set by the application prior to inclusion of nx_ppp.h.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_SECURE_MEMSET
RefParameter.Description: Define memset function used internal.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_MAX_PASSWORD
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of bytes allowed in a client supplied password. The default value is set to 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CURRENT_YEAR
RefParameter.Description: To display date in year/month/date format, set this value to equal or less than current year (need not be same year as in NTP time being evaluated). The default value is 2015.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_ECDH_SCRATCH_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines ecdh scratch buffer size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV6_RX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables ICMPv6 checksum computation on received ICMP packets.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SERVER_DUID_VENDOR_ASSIGNED_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: Sets the upper limit on the Vendor assigned ID. The default value is 48.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_PROTOCOL_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: This defines the wait option (in seconds) for the PPP task to receive a response to a PPP protocol request message. The default value is 4 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of packets to keep in the Client UDP socket receive queue before NetX Duo discards packets. The default value is 5.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_RECEIVE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_socket_receive calls. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_MULTIPART_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, enables HTTPS Server to support multipart HTTP requests.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DRIVER_DEFERRED_PROCESSING
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables deferred network driver packet handling. This allows the network driver to place a packet on the IP instance and have the real processing routine called from the NetX Duo internal IP helper thread.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_MAX_PSK_KEYS
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the maximum PSK keys.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_TIME_TO_LIVE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of routers this packet can pass before it is discarded. The default value is set to 0x80.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_CACHE_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: This enables the DNS Client to store the answer records into DNS cache.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTPS_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, this macro enables TLS and HTTPS. Leave undefined to free up resources if only plaintext HTTP is desired. By default, this macro is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_DIGEST_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, authentication using the MD5 digest is enabled on the HTTPS Server. By default it is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_IPV6_ADDRESS_CHANGE_NOTIFY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows a callback function to be invoked when the IPv6 address is changed. By default this option is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_QUERY_MIN_TIMER_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The minimum time interval, in ticks, between two queries. The default value is 100 ticks for 1 second.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_MIN_PACKET_PAYLOAD
RefParameter.Description: Define the minimum PPP packet payload, the PPP commands (LCP, PAP, CHAP, IPCP) should be in one packet. The default value is (NX_PPP_PACKET + 128).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_MAX_PSK_NONCE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the TLS maximum psk monce size. The default value is 255.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MAX_STRING_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: Define the max string length.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ARP_EXPIRATION_RATE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of seconds ARP entries remain valid. The default value of zero disables expiration or aging of ARP entries and is defined in nx_api.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_TCP_KEEPALIVE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the optional TCP keepalive timer. The default settings is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_IGNORE_MAX_ADJUST_STARTUP
RefParameter.Description: This enables the maximum time adjustment to be waived when the Client receives the first update from its time server. Thereafter, the maximum time adjustment is enforced. The intention is to get the Client in synch with the server clock as soon as possible. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is NX_TRUE.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RESPONSE_SHARED_DELAY_MIN
RefParameter.Description: The minimum delay, in ticks, in responding to a query to a shared resource. The default value is 2 ticks for 20ms.

RefParameter.Name: NTP_SECONDS_AT_01011999
RefParameter.Description: This is the number of seconds into the first NTP Epoch on the master NTP clock. It is defined as 0xBA368E80. To disable display of NTP seconds into date and time, set to zero.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_PACKET_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables packet pool information gathering.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_MESSAGE_MAX
RefParameter.Description: The maximum DNS message size for sending DNS queries. The default value is 512, which is also the maximum size specified in RFC 1035 Section 2.3.4.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_IMMEDIATE_ACK
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the optional TCP immediate ACK response processing. Defining this symbol is equivalent to defining NX_TCP_ACK_EVERY_N_PACKETS to be 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_RECEIVE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_socket_receive() calls. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_X509_USE_EXTENDED_DISTINGUISHED_NAMES
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables the optional X.509 Distinguished Name fields, at the expense of extra memory use for X.509 certificates.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_ARP_PROBE_MIN
RefParameter.Description: Defines the minimum variation in the interval between sending ARP probes. The value is defaulted to 1 second.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ENABLE_DTLS
RefParameter.Description: This macro must be defined to enable DTLS logic in NetX Secure.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_RETRY_MAX
RefParameter.Description: This sets the maximum number of retransmissions on Server socket. The default value is set to 10.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_EXP_BACKOFF_RATE
RefParameter.Description: The factor by which the current Client unicast poll interval is increased. When the Client fails to receive a server time update, or receiving indications from the server that it is temporarily unavailable (e.g. not synchronized yet) for time update service, it will increase the current poll interval by this rate up to but not exceeding NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MAX_TIME_LAPSE. The default is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_CONFLICT_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: Maximum conflict count for host name or service name. The default value is 8.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MAX_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: Maximum number of UDP packets (datagrams) that can be queued in the NetX Duo SNTP Client socket. Additional packets received mean the oldest packets are released. The default NetX Duo SNTP Client is set to 5.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_SERVER_THREAD_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: This option specifies the priority of the DHCP Server thread. By default, this value specifies that the DHCP thread runs at priority 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_FRAGMENTATION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables both IPv4 and IPv6 fragmentation and reassembly logic. If checked, the parameter NX_DISABLE_PACKET_CHAIN will be available.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MIN_SERVER_STRATUM
RefParameter.Description: The lowest level (highest numeric stratum level) SNTP Server stratum the Client will accept. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is 2.

RefParameter.DefaultValue: IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-CLIENT MUST USE MULTICAST
RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_USE_MULTICAST
RefParameter.Description: This defines the status option message for : NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_USE_MULTICAST. The default value is "IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-CLIENT MUST USE MULTICAST".

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_ARP_MAC_CHANGE_NOTIFICATION
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows ARP to invoke a callback notify function on detecting the MAC address is updated.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_MAX_RECORDS
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of interface records to save to the DHCP Client instance. A DHCP Client interface record is a record of the DHCP Client running on a specific interface. The default value is set as physical interfaces count (NX_MAX_PHYSICAL_INTERFACES).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ERROR_CHECKING
RefParameter.Description: Defined, removes the basic NetX Duo error checking API and improves performance. API return codes not affected by disabling error checking are listed in bold typeface in the API definition. This define is typically used after the application is debugged sufficiently and its use improves performance and decreases code size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_ECJPAKE_SCRATCH_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the ecjpake scratch buffer size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ENABLE_ECC_CIPHERSUITE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables the ECC support in TLS.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_ENABLE_BOOTP
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables the BOOTP protocol instead of DHCP. By default this option is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ALLOW_SELF_SIGNED_CERTIFICATES
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option allows TLS to accept self-signed certificates from a remote host. By default, TLS will reject self-signed server certificates as a security precaution. If this macro is defined, self-signed certificates must still be added to the trusted store to be accepted.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_FRAGMENT_OPTION
RefParameter.Description: Fragment enable for HTTP TCP requests. By default, this value is NX_DONT_FRAGMENT to disable HTTP TCP fragmenting.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ENABLE_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_VERIFY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables the optional X.509 Client Certificate Verification for TLS Servers4.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: The priority of the HTTPS Server thread. By default, this value is defined as 4 to specify priority 4.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MAX_UNICAST_SOLICIT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of Neighbor Solicitation messages NetX Duo transmits to determine a specific neighbor's reachability. Defined in nx_nd_cache.h, the default value is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_MULTIPART_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, enables HTTP Server to support multipart HTTP requests.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_PACKET_ALLOCATE_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the timeout in timer ticks for the NetX DHCP Server to wait for allocate a packet from its packet pool. The default value is set to NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MAX_ROOT_DISPERSION
RefParameter.Description: The maximum server clock dispersion (microseconds), which is a measure of server clock precision, the Client will accept. To disable this requirement, set the maximum root dispersion to 0x0. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is set to 50000.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ASSERT_FAIL
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that defines the debug statement to use when an assertion fails.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV6_DEFAULT_ROUTER_TABLE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of entries in the IPv6 routing table. At least one entry is needed for the default router. Defined in nx_api.h, the default value is 8.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IP_RAW_MAX_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that controls the number of raw IP packets can be queued on the raw packet receive queue. By default value is set to 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DEBUG_LOG_PRINT_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, internal PPP debug log printf to stdio is enabled. This is only valid if the debug log is also enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_MEMCMP
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the memory compare function.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_UDP_PORT
RefParameter.Description: This sets the port which the Client socket is bound to. The default NetX Duo SNTP Client port is 123.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_MAX_PSK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the maximum size of PSK.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV6_DAD_TRANSMITS
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of Neighbor Solicitation messages to be sent before NetX Duo marks an interface address as valid. If NX_DISABLE_IPV6_DAD is defined (DAD disabled), setting this option has no effect. Alternatively, a value of zero (0) turns off DAD but leaves the DAD functionality in NetX Duo. Defined in nx_api.h, the default value is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_MIN_RETRANS_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the minimum wait option for receiving a DHCP Server reply to client message before retransmitting the message. The default value is the RFC 2131 recommended 4 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_TYPE_OF_SERVICE
RefParameter.Description: Type of service required for the HTTPS TCP requests. By default, this value is defined as NX_IP_NORMAL to indicate normal IP packet service.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_IPV6_MULTICAST
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables IPv6 multicast join/leave function. By default this option is not enabled.

RefParameter.DefaultValue: IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-INVALID CLIENT REQUEST
RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_NO_BINDING
RefParameter.Description: This defines the status option message for : NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_NO_BINDING. The default value is "IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-INVALID CLIENT REQUEST".

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description:
When defined, MQTT Client is built with TLS support.
Defining this symbol requires NetX Secure TLS module to be enabled. NX_SECURE_ENABLE is not enabled by default.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_DEFAULT_VALID_TIME
RefParameter.Description: This defines the time expiration in seconds assigned by the Server on an assigned Client IP address lease. After this time expires, the Client IP address is invalid. The default value is 2 NX_DHCPV6_DEFAULT_PREFERRED_TIME.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_PROBE_MAX
RefParameter.Description: The maximum number of seconds to wait between sending probes. By default, this value is defined as 2.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_SECURE_MEMMOVE
RefParameter.Description: Define memmove function used internal.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_DEFAULT_T1_TIME
RefParameter.Description: The time in seconds assigned by the Server on a Client address lease for when the Client should begin renewing its IP address. The default value is 2000 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_ARP_PROBE_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: Defines the length of time the DHCP Client waits for a response after sending an ARP probe. The default value is one second (1 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_SERVER_DISABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Defined, this option removes all TLS stack code related to TLS Server mode, reducing code and data usage.
NX_SECURE_TLS_SERVER_DISABLED and NX_SECURE_TLS_CLIENT_DISABLED are mutually exclusive: either NX_SECURE_TLS_SERVER_DISABLED or NX_SECURE_TLS_CLIENT_DISABLED must be disabled

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Can be true only if NX_SECURE_TLS_CLIENT_DISABLED is false

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IPV6_PURGE_UNUSED_CACHE_ENTRIES
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option prevents NetX Duo from removing older cache table entries before their timeout expires to make room for new entries when the table is full. Static and router entries are never purged.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MAX_TIME_LAPSE
RefParameter.Description: Maximum allowable amount of time (seconds) elapsed without a valid time update received by the SNTP Client. The SNTP Client will continue in operation but the SNTP Server status is set to NX_FALSE. The default value is 7200.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_CLIENT_SOCKET_WINDOW_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Define the default TCP socket window size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_TIME_TO_LIVE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of routers a packet can pass before it is discarded. The default value is 0x80.

RefParameter.Name: FEATURE_NX_IPV6
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enable IPV6 features.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_SERVICE_NAME_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Maximum string size for service name. The default value is 64. Does not include the NULL terminator.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_NUM_DNS_SERVERS
RefParameter.Description: Number of DNS servers to store to the client record. The default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_MAX_CONFLICTS
RefParameter.Description: The number of AutoIP conflicts before increasing processing delays. By default, this value is defined as 10.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_MAX_ENTROPY_LEN
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the drbg max entropy length. The default value is 125.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ICMPV6_RTR_SOLICITATION_DELAY
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum delay for the initial router solicitation in seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_MAX_PSK_ID_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the maximum size of PSK ID.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_RESET_DISCONNECT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables the reset processing during disconnect when the timeout value supplied is specified as NX_NO_WAIT.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_RECEIVE_TIMEOUTS
RefParameter.Description: This defines the number of times the PPP thread task times out waiting to receive the next character in a PPP message stream. Thereafter, PPP releases the packet and begins waiting to receive the next PPP message. The default value is 4.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ARP_DEFEND_BY_REPLY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows NetX Duo to defend its IP address by sending an ARP response.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_KEY_CLEAR
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables key related materials cleanup when they are not used anymore.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_MAX_NAME
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of bytes allowed in a client supplied username. The default value is set to 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV6_MAX_REASSEMBLY_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that controls the maximum time allowed to reassemble IPv6 fragment.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MAX_IPV6_ADDRESSES
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of entries in the IPv6 address pool. During interface configuration, NetX Duo uses IPv6 entries from the pool. It is defaulted to (NX_MAX_PHYSICAL_INTERFACES * 3) to allow each interface to have at least one link local address and two global addresses. Note that all interfaces share the IPv6 address pool.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_RETRY_SHIFT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies how the retransmit timeout period changes between retries. If this value is 0, the initial retransmit timeout is the same as subsequent retransmit timeouts. If this value is 1, each successive retransmit is twice as long. If this value is 2, each subsequent retransmit timeout is four times as long. The default value is 0 and is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Size of the buffer in the Client record to hold the option status message in a Server reply. The default value is 100 bytes.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_PROBING_TIMER_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The time interval, in ticks, between mDNS probing messages. The default value is 25 ticks for 250ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_PACKET_WAIT_OPTION
RefParameter.Description: This defines the wait option for the Server nx_udp_socket_receive call. This is perfunctory since the socket has a receive notify callback from NetX Duo, so the packet is already enqueued when the DHCPv6 server calls the receive function. The default value is 1 second (1 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_PATH_MTU_INCREASE_WAIT_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the wait interval in timer ticks to reset the path MTU for a specific target in the destination table. If NX_DISABLE_IPV6_PATH_MTU_DISCOVERY is defined, defining this symbol has no effect.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMP_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables ICMP information gathering.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_TIMER_COUNT_RANGE
RefParameter.Description: When sending out mDNS responses, the packet contains responses that otherwise would be sent within this timer counter range. The timer count range is expressed in ticks. The default value is 12 for 120ms. This value allows a response to include messages that would be sent within the next 120ms range if each tick is 10ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PHYSICAL_TRAILER
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size in bytes of the physical packet trailer and is typically used to reserve storage for things like Ethernet CRCs, etc. The default value is 4 and is defined in nx_api.h.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_MEMMOVE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the memory move function.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_DTLS_COOKIE_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the length of DTLS cookie.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_THREAD_TIME_SLICE
RefParameter.Description: Time-slice option for PPP threads. By default, this value is TX_NO_TIME_SLICE. This define can be set by the application prior to inclusion of nx_ppp.h.By default, it is TX_NO_TIME_SLICE.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_DTLS_RETRANSMIT_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the initial DTLS retransmit rate.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Defines the time out in the TCP socket disconnect call when disconnecting from the MQTT server in timer ticks. The default value is NX_WAIT_FOREVER.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_PREDICTION_RESISTANCE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines drbg prediction resistance.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_SEND
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_socket_send() calls. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_PACKET_TIME_OUT
RefParameter.Description: Time out in seconds for allocating a packet from the Client packet pool. The default value is 3 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_UDP_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables UDP information gathering.

RefParameter.DefaultValue: IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-NO ADDRESSES AVAILABLE
RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_NO_ADDRS_AVAILABLE
RefParameter.Description: This defines the status option message for : NX_DHCPV6_STATUS_MESSAGE_NO_ADDRS_AVAILABLE. The default value is "IA OPTION NOT GRANTED-NO ADDRESSES AVAILABLE".

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_PACKET_POOL_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Defines the Server packet pool size for packets the Server will allocate to send DHCPv6 messages out. The default value is (10 * NX_DHCPV6_PACKET_SIZE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_CLIENT_USER_CREATE_PACKET_POOL
RefParameter.Description: This enables the DNS Client to let the application create and set the DNS Client packet pool. By default this option is disabled, and the DNS Client creates its own packet pool in nx_dns_create.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV6_ROUTER_ADVERTISEMENT_PROCESS
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables NetX Duo from processing information received in IPv6 router advertisement packets.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_CBC_MAX_BLOCK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines cbc max block size. The default value is 16.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_OPTIONS_MAX
RefParameter.Description: This is size of the array in the DHCP Client instance for holding the all the requested options in the parameter request list in the current session. The default value is 12.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_SESSION_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of simultaneous sessions for an HTTP or HTTPS Server. A TCP socket and a TLS session (if HTTPS is enabled) are allocated for each session. The default value is set to 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_MIN_NTP_VERSION
RefParameter.Description: Oldest SNTP version the Client will be able to work with. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is Version 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_SOURCE_ADDRESS_CHECK
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the source address of incoming packet to be checked. By default this option is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_DTLS_MAXIMUM_RETRANSMIT_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the maximum DTLS retransmit rate. The default value is 60 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_NUM_TIME_SERVERS
RefParameter.Description: Number of time servers to store to the client record. The default value is 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_DEFAULT_T2_TIME
RefParameter.Description: The time in seconds assigned by the Server on a Client address lease for when the Client should begin rebinding its IP address assuming its attempt to renew failed. The default value is 3000 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_ICMP_ADDRESS_CHECK
RefParameter.Description: Defined, the destination address of ICMP packet is checked. The default is disabled. An ICMP Echo Request destined to an IP broadcast or IP multicast address will be silently discarded.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_THREAD_TIME_SLICE
RefParameter.Description: This option sets the time slice of the scheduler allows for Client thread execution. The default NetX Duo SNTP Client size is TX_NO_TIME_SLICE.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_CLIENT_MIN_PACKET_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the minimum size of the packets in the pool specified at Client creation. The minimum size is needed to ensure the complete HTTP header can be contained in one packet. The default value is set to 600.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_SEND
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_socket_send calls. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_MEMCPY
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the memory copy function.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_ARP_PROBE_NUM
RefParameter.Description: Defines the number of ARP probes sent for determining if the IP address assigned by the DHCP server is already in use. The value is defaulted to 3 probes.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DELAY_FIRST_PROBE_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the delay in seconds before the first solicitation is sent out for a cache entry in the STALE state. Defined in nx_nd_cache.h, the default value is 5.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV6_NEIGHBOR_CACHE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of entries in the IPv6 Neighbor Cache table. Defined in nx_nd_cache.h, the default value is 16.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_THREAD_TIME_SLICE
RefParameter.Description: The number of timer ticks the Server thread is allowed to run before yielding to threads of the same priority. The default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RR_TTL_HOST
RefParameter.Description: TTL value for resource records with host name, in second. The default value is 120 for 120s.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_THREAD_TIME_SLICE
RefParameter.Description: The number of timer ticks the Server thread is allowed to run before yielding to threads of the same priority. The default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ASSERT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables ASSERT checks in the source code. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_THREAD_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: This option sets the Client thread priority. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_RETRY_SECONDS
RefParameter.Description: Set the Server socket retransmission timeout in seconds. The default value is set to 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_LOOPBACK_INTERFACE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables NetX Duo support for the loopback interface.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_ECDSA_SCRATCH_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines crypto ecdsa scratch buffer size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IP_ROUTING_TABLE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, sets the maximum number of entries in the IPv4 static routing table, which is a list of an outgoing interface and the next hop addresses for a given destination address. The default value is 8 and is defined in nx_api.h. This symbol is used only if NX_ENABLE_IP_STATIC_ROUTING is defined.

Condition.Diagnostic: Can be set to enabled only if NX_ENABLE_IP_STATIC_ROUTING is set

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DNS_OPTION_DISABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, the primary DNS Server Option is disabled in the IPCP response. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_NAT_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, NetX Duo is built with NAT process. By default this option is not defined. This option can be defined only when NX_DISABLE_IPV4 is not selected.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_NO_FILEX
RefParameter.Description:
Creates a stub file for FileX API. For systems working without FileX
When a FileSystem is needed this option should be set to flase FileX should be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MAX_MULTICAST_GROUPS
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of multicast groups that can be joined. The default value is 7 and is defined in nx_api.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ND_MAX_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that defines the maximum number of packets queued up for Neighbor Discovery cache to be resolved. By default this symbol is set to 4.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV6_PREFIX_LIST_TABLE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of the prefix table. Prefix information is obtained from router advertisements and is part of the IPv6 address configuration. Defined in nx_api.h, the default value is 8.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_DISABLE_PROTOCOL_VERSION_DOWNGRADE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables protocol version downgrade for TLS client.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_SUBNET_MASK
RefParameter.Description: This is the subnet mask the DHCP Client should be configured with. The default value is set to 0xFFFFFF00.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: Sets the maximum number of packets to store on the socket receive queue. The default value is 5.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_ACCEPT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_server_socket_accept() calls. The default value is set to (1 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_SECURE_MEMCPY
RefParameter.Description: Define memcpy function used internal.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: The priority of the HTTP Server thread. By default, this value is defined as 16 to specify priority 16.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DEBUG_LOG_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, internal PPP debug log is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_ANNOUNCE_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: The number of seconds to wait between sending announces. By default, this value is defined as 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IPV6_DAD
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option disables Duplicate Address Detection (DAD) during IPv6 address assignment. Addresses are set either by manual configuration or through Stateless Address Auto Configuration.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_PACKET_ALLOCATE_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: This sets the timeout option for allocating a packet from the DNS client packet pool. The default value is 1 second (1*NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_UPDATE_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: The interval (seconds) at which the SNTP Client timer updates the SNTP Client time remaining since the last valid update received, and the unicast Client updates the poll interval time remaining before sending the next SNTP update request. The default value is 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, specifies the number of ThreadX timer ticks in one second. The default value is derived from the ThreadX symbol TX_TIMER_TICKS_PER_SECOND, which by default is set to 100 (10ms timer). Applications shall exercise caution when modifying this value, as the rest of the NetX Duo modules derive timing information from NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_DTLS_MAXIMUM_RETRANSMIT_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the maximum retransmit retries for DTLS handshake packet.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_ACCEPT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_server_socket_accept calls. The default value is set to (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DEBUG_PACKET
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables the optional debug packet dumping available in the RAM Ethernet network driver.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_MAX_PENDING
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of connections that can be queued for the HTTP Server. The default value is set to 5.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_MAXIMUM_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: Specifies how many data transmit retries are allowed before the connection is deemed broken. The default value is 10, which represents 10 retries, and is defined in nx_tcp.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_TYPE_OF_SERVICE
RefParameter.Description: Type of service required for the DNS UDP requests. By default, this value is defined as NX_IP_NORMAL for normal IP packet service.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MAX_MULTICAST_SOLICIT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of Neighbor Solicitation messages NetX Duo transmits as part of the IPv6 Neighbor Discovery protocol when mapping between IPv6 address and MAC address is required. Defined in nx_nd_cache.h, the default value is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_WEB_HTTP_MAX_PASSWORD
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of bytes allowed in a client supplied password. The default value is set to 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_MAX_RETRANS_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum wait option for receiving a DHCP Server reply to client message before retransmitting the message. The default value is 64 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_MUTEX_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: Time out option for obtaining an exclusive lock on a DHCPv6 Client mutex. The default value is TX_WAIT_FOREVER.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_ENABLE_EXTENDED_RR_TYPES
RefParameter.Description: This enables the DNS Client to query on additional DNS record types in (e.g. CNAME, NS, MX, SOA, SRV and TXT).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_RNG_CHECK_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the random number check for duplication.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_PACKET_POOL_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of the DHCP Client packet pool. The default value is (5 *NX_DHCP_PACKET_PAYLOAD) which will provide four packets plus room for internal packet pool overhead.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMP_TX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables both ICMPv4 and ICMPv6 checksum computation on transmitted ICMP packets. This option is useful where the network interface driver is able to compute the ICMPv4 and ICMPv6 checksum, and the application does not use the IP fragmentation feature or IPsec feature. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_MSS_MINIMUM
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that defines the minimal MSS value NetX Duo TCP module accepts. This feature is enabled by NX_ENABLE_TCP_MSS_CHECK.

Condition.Diagnostic: Can be set to enabled only if NX_ENABLE_TCP_MSS_CHECK is set

RefParameter.Name: NX_TCP_MAX_OUT_OF_ORDER_PACKETS
RefParameter.Description: Symbol that defines the maximum number of out-of-order TCP packets can be kept in the TCP socket receive queue. This symbol can be used to limit the number of packets queued in the TCP receive socket, preventing the packet pool from being starved. By default this symbol is not defined, thus there is no limit on the number of out of order packets being queued in the TCP socket.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_PROBING_RETRANSMIT_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The number of retransmitted probing messages. The default value is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_DEBUG
RefParameter.Description: This option enables printing a debugging trace using printf.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_BASE_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: This defines the period rate (in timer ticks) that the PPP thread task is woken to check for PPP events. The default value is 1*NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE (100 ticks).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_INVALID_UPDATE_LIMIT
RefParameter.Description: The limit on the number of consecutive invalid updates received from the Client server in either broadcast or unicast mode. When this limit is reached, the Client sets the current SNTP Server status to invalid (NX_FALSE) although it will continue to try to receive updates from the Server. The NetX Duo SNTP Client default is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_DISABLE_SERVER
RefParameter.Description:
Disables the mDNS/DNS-SD server functionality. Without the server functionality, the mDNS/DNS-SD module does not announce services provided by local host, nor does it respond to mDNS enquiries. This symbol is not defined by default.
NX_MDNS_DISABLE_SERVER and NX_MDNS_DISABLE_CLIENT cannot be enabled simultaneously.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Can only be enabled when NX_MDNS_DISABLE_CLIENT is disabled

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_PROBE_MIN
RefParameter.Description: The minimum number of seconds to wait between sending probes. By default, this value is defined as 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PHYSICAL_HEADER
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size in bytes of the physical header of the frame. The default value is 16 (based on a typical 14-byte Ethernet frame aligned to 32-bit boundary) and is defined in nx_api.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included, such as in nx_user.h.
