RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV4_TX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables ICMPv4 checksum computation on transmitted ICMP packets. This option is defined automatically if NX_DISABLE_ICMP_TX_CHECKSUM is defined. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_RETRY_SHIFT
RefParameter.Description: This value is used to set the next retransmission timeout. The current timeout is multiplied by the number of retransmissions thus far, shifted by the value of the socket timeout shift. The default value is set to 1 for doubling the timeout.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RESPONSE_UNIQUE_DELAY
RefParameter.Description: The delay, in ticks, in responding to a query to a service that is unique to the local network. The default value is 1 tick for 10ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_DUAL_PACKET_POOL
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows the stack to use two packet pools, one with large payload size and one with smaller payload size. By default this option is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_EXTENDED_NOTIFY_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables more callback hooks in the stack. These callback functions are used by the BSD wrapper layer. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NetXDuo_Version
RefParameter.Description: NetXDuo version

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_MINIMUM_CERTIFICATE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines a minimum reasonable size for a TLS X509 certificate. This is used in checking for * errors in allocating certificate space. The size is determined by assuming a 512-bit RSA key, MD5 hash, and a rough estimate of other data. It is theoretically possible for a real certificate to be smaller, but in that case, bypass the error checking by re-defining this macro. Approximately: 64(RSA) + 16(MD5) + 176(ASN.1 + text data, common name, etc)

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_NTP_VERSION
RefParameter.Description: SNTP version used by the Client The NetX Duo SNTP Client API was based on Version 4. The default value is 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_REACHABLE_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the time out in seconds for a cache entry to exist in the REACHABLE state with no packets received from the cache destination IPv6 address. Defined in nx_nd_cache.h, the default value is 30.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_REQUIRE_TLS
RefParameter.Description: Defined, application must use TLS to connect to MQTT broker. This feature requires NX_SECURE_ENABLE defined. By default, this symbol is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_DISABLE_CHAP
RefParameter.Description: If defined, internal PPP CHAP logic is removed, including the MD5 digest logic.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_SERVER_DUID_VENDOR_ASSIGNED_ID
RefParameter.Description: Create a Server DUID with a vendor assigned ID. Note the DUID type must be set NX_DHCPV6_DUID_TYPE_VENDOR_ASSIGNED.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_NAME_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of â€œnameâ€ strings used in authentication. The default value is set to 32bytes, but can be redefined prior to inclusion of *nx_ppp.h.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_LOW_WATERMARK
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables NetX Duo packet pool low watermark feature. Application sets low watermark value. On receiving TCP packets, if the packet pool low watermark is reached, NetX Duo silently discards the packet by releasing it, preventing the packet pool from starvation. By default this feature is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RR_DELETE_DELAY_TIMER_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The delay for deleting a resource record when the TTL of this record is zero, in ticks, The default value is 100 ticks for 1 second (NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ENABLE_ECJPAKE_CIPHERSUITE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables ECJPAKE ciphersuites for DTLS.

RefParameter.Name: NX_FRAGMENT_IMMEDIATE_ASSEMBLY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows IPv4 and IPv6 reassembly logic to execute right away after receiving an IP fragment. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_RATE_LIMIT_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: The number of seconds to extend the wait period when the total number of conflicts is exceeded. By default, this value is defined as 60.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ENABLE_AEAD_CIPHER
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables AEAD ciphersuites.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_SNI_EXTENSION_DISABLED
RefParameter.Description: This option disables Server Name Indication (SNI) extension.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_TCP_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables TCP information gathering.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_MUTEX_PUT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables drbg mutex put.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_RX_SIZE_CHECKING
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables the size checking on received packets.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_MEMSET
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the memory set function.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_TYPE_OF_SERVICE
RefParameter.Description: Type of service required for the DHCP UDP requests. By default, this value is defined as NX_IP_NORMAL to indicate normal IP packet service.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMPV4_RX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables ICMPv4 checksum computation on received ICMP packets. This option is defined automatically if NX_DISABLE_ICMP_RX_CHECKSUM is defined. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_QUERY_MAX_TIMER_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The maximum time interval, in ticks, between two queries. The default value is 360000 for 60 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_BLOCK_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the drbg block length. The default value is NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_BLOCK_LENGTH_AES.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IGMP_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables IGMP information gathering.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_RTT_REQUIRED
RefParameter.Description: This option if enabled requires that the SNTP Client calculate round trip time of SNTP messages when applying Server updates to the local clock. The default value is NX_FALSE (disabled).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_SERVER_HOSTNAME_MAX
RefParameter.Description: This is size of the buffer for holding the Server host name. The default value is 32.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_IPV6_ADDRESS_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: Maximum IPv6 addresses count of host. The default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_ENABLE_SSL_3_0
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables SSL 3.0 .

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_IP_INFO
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables IP information gathering.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MAX_LISTEN_REQUESTS
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of server listen requests. The default value is 10 and is defined in nx_api.h. The application can override the default by defining the value before nx_api.h is included.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ARP_MAX_QUEUE_DEPTH
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of packets that can be queued while waiting for an ARP response. The default value is 4 and is defined in nx_api.h.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_PROBE_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: The number of seconds to wait before sending first probe. By default, this value is defined as 1.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_SEED_BUFFER_LEN
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the drbg seed buffer length. The default value is 256.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_ENABLE_PSK_CIPHERSUITES
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables Pre-Shared Key (PSK) functionality. It does not disable digital certificates.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_THREAD_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: Priority of the DHCP thread. By default, this value specifies that the DHCP thread runs at priority 3.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_CLIENT_SEND_ARP_PROBE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this enables the DHCP Client to send an ARP probe after IP address assignment to verify the assigned DHCP address is not owned by another host. By default, this option is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_MAX_PAP_PROTOCOL_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description: This defines the max number of retries if the PPP times out before sending another PAP authentication request message. When this number is reached the PPP handshake is aborted and the link status is down. The default value is 20.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_POOF_MIN_COUNT
RefParameter.Description: The number of queries that no multicast response, then the host may take this as an indication that the record may no longer be valid. The default value is 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_USE_SCSV_CIPHPERSUITE
RefParameter.Description: This option enables SCSV ciphersuite in ClientHello message.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_MAX_HEADER_FIELD
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum size of the HTTP header field. The default value is 256.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCPV6_TIME_TO_LIVE
RefParameter.Description: The number of times a Client packet is forwarded by a network router before the packet is discarded. The default value is 0x80.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_UDP_TYPE_OF_SERVICE
RefParameter.Description: Define UDP socket create options.

RefParameter.Name: NX_AUTO_IP_ANNOUNCE_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: The number of seconds to wait before sending announcement. By default, this value is defined as 2.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PACKET_ALIGNMENT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, specifies the alignment requirement, in bytes, for starting address of the packet payload area. This option deprecates NX_PACKET_HEADER_PAD and NX_PACKET_HEADER_PAD_SIZE. By default this option is defined to be 4, making the starting address of the payload area 4-byte aligned.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_SERVER_TIMEOUT_DISCONNECT
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of ThreadX ticks that internal services will suspend for in internal nx_tcp_socket_disconnect calls. The default value is set to 10 seconds (10 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RESPONSE_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: The time interval, in ticks, in responding to a query to ensure an interval of at least 1s since the last time the record was multicast. The default value is 100 ticks (NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_CLIENT_CLEAR_QUEUE
RefParameter.Description: This enables the DNS Client to clear old DNS messages off the receive queue before sending a new query. Removing these packets from previous DNS queries prevents the DNS Client socket queue from overflowing and dropping valid packets.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_RESTART_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: Defines the length of time the DHCP Client waits to restart DHCP if the IP address assigned to the DHCP Client is already in use. The value is defaulted to 10 seconds.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_RESPONSE_TC_DELAY_MIN
RefParameter.Description: The minimum delay, in ticks, in responding to a query with TC bit. The default value is 40 ticks for 400ms.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IP_STATUS_CHECK_WAIT_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Define the amount of time to sleep in nx_ip_(interface_)status_check

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_TIME_INTERVAL
RefParameter.Description: Interval in seconds when the DHCP Client timer expiration function executes. This function updates all the timeouts in the DHCP process e.g. if messages should be retransmitted or DHCP Client state changed. By default, this value is 1 second.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SNTP_CLIENT_RANDOMIZE_ON_STARTUP
RefParameter.Description: This determines if the SNTP Client in unicast mode should send its first SNTP request with the current SNTP server after a random wait interval. It is used in cases where significant numbers of SNTP Clients are starting up simultaneously to limit traffic congestion on the SNTP Server. The default value is NX_FALSE.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV6_STATELESS_AUTOCONFIG_CONTROL
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows NetX Duo to disable stateless address autoconfiguration feature. By default this option is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_HTTP_NO_FILEX
RefParameter.Description:
Creates a stub file for FileX API. For systems working without FileX
When a FileSystem is needed this option should be set to flase FileX should be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NX_IPV6_DESTINATION_TABLE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of entries in the IPv6 destination table. This stores information about next hop addresses for IPv6 addresses. Defined in nx_api.h, the default value is 8.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_TCP_QUEUE_DEPTH_UPDATE_NOTIFY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, allows the application to install a callback function that is invoked when the TCP transmit queue depth is no longer at maximum value. This callback serves as an indication that the TCP socket is ready to transmit more data. By default this option is not enabled.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_KEEPALIVE_TIMER_RATE
RefParameter.Description: Defines the MQTT timer rate, in ThreadX timer ticks. This timer is used to keep track of the time since last MQTT control message was sent, and sends out an MQTT PINGREQ message before the keep-alive time expires. This timer is activated if the client connects to the broker with a keep-alive timer value set. The default value is TX_TIMER_TICKS_PER_SECOND, which is a one-second timer. The default value is TX_TIMER_TICKS_PER_SECOND.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DNS_MAX_RETRANS_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: The maximum retransmission timeout on a DNS query to a specific DNS server. The default value is 64 seconds (64 * NX_IP_PERIODIC_RATE).

RefParameter.Name: NX_DISABLE_ICMP_RX_CHECKSUM
RefParameter.Description: Defined, disables both ICMPv4 and ICMPv6 checksum computation on received ICMP packets. This option is useful when the network interface driver is able to verify the ICMPv4 and ICMPv6 checksum, and the application does not use the IP fragmentation feature or the IPsec feature. By default this option is not defined.

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_DRBG_MUTEX_GET
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this option enables drbg mutex get.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_MINIMUM_MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This option defines the minimum size for the TLS message buffer. It is determined by a number of factors, but primarily the expected size of the TLS handshake Certificate message (sent by the TLS server) that may contain multiple certificates of 1-2KB each. The upper limit is determined by the length field in the TLS header (16 bit), and is 64KB.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_VALUE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of â€œvalueâ€ strings used in CHAP authentication. The default value is set to 32bytes, but can be redefined prior to inclusion of nx_ppp.h.

RefParameter.Name: TX_TIMER_TICKS_PER_SECOND
RefParameter.Description: Define the common timer tick reference for use by other middleware components

RefParameter.Name: NX_APP_MEM_POOL_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Default memory pool size for the NETXDUOX application.

RefParameter.Name: NXD_MQTT_CLOUD_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enable MQTT over cloud option.

RefParameter.Name: NX_ENABLE_TCPIP_OFFLOAD
RefParameter.Description: Offload TCP/IP processing to the underlining HW

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_SERVER_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Define the DHCP server thread stack size.

RefParameter.Name: NX_DHCP_SERVER_NAME
RefParameter.Description: Define name of DHCP server.

RefParameter.Name: NX_MDNS_DISABLE_CLIENT
RefParameter.Description:
Disable the mDNS Client functionality. By default, mDNS client function is enabled.
NX_MDNS_DISABLE_CLIENT and NX_MDNS_DISABLE_SERVER cannot be enabled simultaneously.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Can only be enabled when NX_MDNS_DISABLE_SERVER is disabled

RefParameter.Name: NX_CRYPTO_AES_USE_RAM_TABLES
RefParameter.Description: When defined the AES tabled are moved to RAM.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_REQUIRE_RENEGOTIATION_EXT
RefParameter.Description: Defines whether or not the connection should be terminated immediately upon failure to receive the secure renegotiation extension during the initial handshake. By default, the connection is not terminated.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_DISABLE_CLIENT_INITIATED_RENEGOTIATION
RefParameter.Description: Disables client-initiated renegotiation for TLS servers. In some instances, client-initiated renegotiation can become a possible denial-of-service vulnerability.

RefParameter.Name: NX_SECURE_TLS_DISABLE_SECURE_RENEGOTIATION
RefParameter.Description: Disable secure session renegotiation extension.

RefParameter.Name: NX_PPP_OPTION_MESSAGE_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: Size of the NAK list.
